radiographic_examinations.findings: 3 mm triangular nodule in the left lower lobe, unremarkable liver, spleen, both adrenals, both kidneys, pancreas and gallbladder, duodenal diverticulum, small hypodensity in the lower pole of the left kidney, sigmoid colon with contained microperforation containing air and significant fat stranding, normal rectum, bladder, prostate, both seminal vesicles and appendix, small amount of pelvic free fluid, bone island in the left iliac crest, moderate rotatory scoliosis of the lumbar spine with degenerative endplate changes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The 3 mm triangular nodule in the left lower lobe is unchanged from the previous CT.
